image:image.image:title: People chatting at brown cafe 't Smalle
image:image.image:caption: Netherlands, Amsterdam. People chatting at brown cafe 't Smalle at the Egelantiersgracht. The Egelantiersgracht lays in the city-area the Jordaan, one of the oldest folky districts in Amterdam. Caf 't Smalle was opened in 1786 by Pieter Hoppe, along with a gin distilery. Mister Hoppe was the founder of the famous Dutch label 'Hoppe', a brand of gin.

image:image.image:title: Figure 12

image:image.image:title: Figure 9
image:image.image:caption: Figure 9. James O’Shea working on the Oxford University Museum. After Benjamin Woodward’s death in 1861, James and his brother John worked in England and Wales for a number of years but there is no trace of them or their work after the late 1860s.
